page.title: 16SHIRE HORSES - LICHFIELD
page.content: Shire horses are stabled at Birmingham Road, Lichfield. They are used for mainly promotional work for the Solid Fuel Advisory Service, although in the winter they do deliver coal for a local coal merchant. There are six horses, four greys and two blacks, a staff of nine, all girls, exercise, groom, feed and clean the harness every day. The stables are open daily for visitors to see the horses, the harness and the vehicles they pull. They attend over 150 promotions during the year, the main one being "The Horse of the Year Show" at Wembley. Regents park, London is visited at Easter and during Xmas, Father Xmas and the Shires are extremely busy. They have 2 weeks holiday in September when they are taken to a nearby farm, have their shoes taken off, and relax.
